saltmarsh 0.0.0.9000

Purge selected fits or maps from database

Source: R/db_purge.R
db_purge.Rd

Called by fitpurge or mappurge to purge database rows or restore them, as well as purging or restoring sidecar files.

Usage

db_purge(which, db_name, id_name, rows, failed, undo)

Arguments

which

Which database? Either fit or map

db_name

Either 'fdb' or 'mdb'

id_name

Either fitid or mapid

rows

Selected rows in the database. Use one of

  • an empty string doesn't purge any rows, but does purge stray fit sidecar files

  • a vector of ids to purge those rows

  • a named list to filter rows. List items are <field in database> = <value>, where <value> is a regex for character fields, or an actual value (or vector of values) for logical or numeric fields.

failed

If TRUE, all rows where success is FALSE or NA are purged. This is an alternative to specifying rows.

undo

Undo previous purges. There is no time limit on undoing, and it doesn't matter whether you've run more fits or maps since a purge. You may supply either:

  • undo = 'last', reverses the previous purge call, and the database and associated files are restored.

  • a vector of fit ids corresponding to previously purged rows. Note that you may view purged fits with fitinfo or mapinfo with purged = TRUE.
